page.title: 15FARLEY'S TREES AND SHRUBS
page.content: Farley is surrounded by woodland. Some of this is softwood (pine) planted for use in the timber industry. Some is old, natural woodland and one of these is Blackmoor Copse. One day in July, 1985, on a walk through Blackmoor Copse we saw the following trees and shrubs: ash, sycamore, ivy, hazel, horse chestnut, holly, oak, honeysuckle, hawthorn, dog rose, lime, yew, old man's beard, pussy willow, blackberry and fir. Hound Wood has a stretch of beeches, probably named after its owner of many years ago and called Shrubb's Beeches. Farley Copse and Brown's Copse are mixed deciduous trees including oak and birch.
